value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #09: VALUES vs. KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: Learn the difference between using VALUES and KEEPFILTERS in CALCULATE. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #10: Using TREATAS
value.excerpt: Learn how to use TREATAS in CALCULATE filter arguments. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a running total over a dimension, like for example the date. Article and download: https://sql.bi/79926

value.title: Header-detail vs star schema models in Tabular and Power BI
value.excerpt: Compare header/detail models and star schemas: even though a star schema might require a few ETL steps and some coding, it is always the best modeling option. Article and download: https://sql.bi/728493?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Introducing RANKX in DAX
value.excerpt: RANKX is a simple function used to rank a value within a list of values. Its use is simple, but it can be a source of frustration for newbies. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760169?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Lookup multiple values in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn different advanced techniques to retrieve multiple values from a lookup table in DAX, improving code readability and performance in DAX queries. value.title: Previous year up to a certain date
value.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. value.title: Using KEEPFILTERS in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains how to use KEEPFILTERS to intersect instead of overriding an existing filter context in DAX. Using FEEPFILTERS simplifies the code and improves performance. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751682?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Creating indexes in Power BI
value.excerpt: A playlist of videos on how to create index columns in Power BI.

topItems.title: Add index to nested tables in Power Query
topItems.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how to add individual  indexes to groups in power query using the M language. #powerquery #powerbi #curbal   Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

topItems.title: DAX Fridays! #165: Create an index based on two or more columns using DAX
topItems.excerpt: DAX Fridays! #: Creaye an index based on multiple columns using DAX  Do you need to create an index based on multiple columns using DAX? Here is a detailed guide on how to do it. value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Stream Analytics

topItems.title: Visualize real-time data with Azure Stream Analytics and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: By combining the stream processing capabilities of Azure Stream Analytics and the data visualization capabilities of Microsoft Power BI, you can create real-time data dashboards.

value.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

value.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
value.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

value.title: Choose a Power BI model framework
value.excerpt: Describe Power BI data model frameworks, their benefits and limitations, and features to help optimize your Power BI data models.

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You'll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you'll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

value.title: Get started with data science in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Get started with data science in Microsoft Fabric by learning how to train a model in a notebook, and track your metrics with MLflow and experiments.

value.title: Get started with Real-Time Analytics in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Get started with Real-Time Analytics in Microsoft Fabric

value.title: Power Platform - Introduction, business value, and demos
value.excerpt: Explore the capabilities of Power Platform applications, as seen in demonstrations and customer case studies.

value.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.

value.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
value.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

value.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

value.title: Configure Power BI report filters
value.excerpt: Report filtering is a complex topic because many techniques are available for filtering a Microsoft Power BI report. However, with complexity comes control, allowing you to design reports that meet requirements and expectations.

value.title: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience
value.excerpt: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience

value.title: Introduction to Power BI embedded analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how developers can programmatically embed analytics in their apps, and about no-code embedding options for simpler requirements.

value.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

value.title: Visualize real-time data with Azure Stream Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: By combining the stream processing capabilities of Azure Stream Analytics and the data visualization capabilities of Microsoft Power BI, you can create real-time data dashboards.
